comments.creator: n1dgq@msn.com
comments.author: n1dgq@msn.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:9.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/9.0.1
Build ID: 20111220165912

Steps to reproduce:

I am running Windows XP and I use Microsoft Outlook 2007, with multiple individual Contact folders.  I imported addresses/contacts from Outlook into the Thunderbird Address Book.


Actual results:

When I import addresses/contacts from Outlook, the Thunderbird Address Book combined all my individual Contact folders into one single Contact folder with duplicate entries. This has happened with all versions of Thunderbird newer than 6.02.


Expected results:

The Thunderbird Address Book should have imported all my individual Outlook Contact folders, and not combined the contents into a single folder.  Thunderbird Versions 6.02 and earlier did not have this problem.
comments.raw_text:
